title: NCP holds anti-aggression march demanding justice for Hadi
body: The National Citizen Party (NCP) held an anti-aggression march on Victory Day this afternoon to protest and demand justice for the shooting of Sharif Osman Hadi. Organised by the Dhaka North Mohanagar unit of the NCP, the march began around 3:30pm from Banglamotor in Dhaka, the party sources said. During the march, NCP leaders and activists chanted slogans demanding justice for Hadi. They also carried placards and banners that read "We Are Hadi, "We will not let Hadi's blood go in vain," "We rise to expel the Indian agents from the country," and "We will fight together against aggression." By passing through Banglamotor, Katabon, and Nilkhet, the procession ended in front of Shaheed Minar, where a rally was held. NCP Convener Nahid Islam, Member Secretary Akhter Hossen, Chief Coordinator Nasiruddin Patwary, Chief Organiser (North) Sarjis Alam, Chief Organiser (South) Hasnat Abdullah, Senior Joint Convener Ariful Islam Adeeb, Senior Joint Member Secretary Tasnim Jara, Senior Joint Convener Samntha Sharmeen, Joint Convener Khaled Saifullah, Joint Organiser Saifullah Hayder and others leader and activists participated in the march.
